fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the site. This input is mandatory.

fields.name: working24x7
fields.description: Specifies whether the site has specific business hours or works 24x7. This input is mandatory.

fields.name: businessHour
fields.description: Specifies the business hours of the site if working 24x7 is false.

fields.name: holidayList
fields.description: Specifies the holiday list of the site.

fields.name: timezoneCode
fields.description: Specifies the timezone of the site. The value should be specified in the IANA time zone database, for example, America/New_York. This input is mandatory.

fields.name: address
fields.description: Specifies the address of the site.

fields.name: contactNumber
fields.description: The contact number of the site.

types.name: CreateTaskInput
types.description: Specifies the input required to create a task.

fields.name: title
fields.description: Specifies the title of the task. This input is mandatory.

fields.name: description
fields.description: Specifies the description of the task.

fields.name: status
fields.description: Specifies the status of the task. The value should be from the WorkStatus (name field) type.

fields.name: estimatedTime
fields.description: Specifies the estimated time of the task in minutes.

fields.name: scheduledStartDate
fields.description: Specifies the scheduled start datetime of the task. The datetime value should be specified in ISO 8601 format i.e., 2022-08-15T13:15:30

fields.name: dueDate
fields.description: Specifies the due datetime of the task. The datetime value should be specified in ISO 8601 format i.e., 2022-08-15T13:15:30

fields.name: technician
fields.description: Specifies the technician to whom the task is assigned.

fields.name: techGroup
fields.description: Specifies the technician group to which the task is assigned.

fields.name: taskOrder
fields.description: The Order in which the tasks should be displayed in UI

fields.name: workItem
fields.description: The workItem to which the task is associated.

types.name: CreateTicketConversationInput
types.description: Specifies the input required to create a ticket conversation.

fields.name: content
fields.description: Specifies the conversation content.

fields.name: user
fields.description: Specifies the user who creates the conversation.

fields.name: time
fields.description: Specifies the datetime when the conversation was created.

fields.name: toUsers
fields.description: Specifies the list of TO recipients.

fields.name: ccUsers
fields.description: Specifies the list of CC recipients.

fields.name: bccUsers
fields.description: Specifies the list of BCC recipients.

fields.name: attachments
fields.description: Specifies the list of attachments

fields.name: ticket
fields.description: Specifies the ticket under which the conversation will be created.

fields.name: sendMail
fields.description: An email will be send for the conversation initiated by the technician. This attribute specifies whether an email need to be send or not.

types.example:
{
  "content": "I cannot access my internet! I'm not sure what's happening!",
  "user": UserIdentifierInput,
  "time": "2025:01:10T10:10:10",
  "toUsers": [RecipientIdentifierInput],
  "ccUsers": [RecipientIdentifierInput],
  "bccUsers": [RecipientIdentifierInput],
  "attachments": [CreateAttachmentInput],
  "ticket": TicketIdentifierInput,
  "sendMail": true
}

types.name: CreateTicketInput
types.description: Specifies the input required to create a ticket.

fields.name: subject
fields.description: Specifies the subject of the ticket. This input is mandatory.

fields.name: description
fields.description: Specifies the description of the ticket.

fields.name: descriptionAttachments
fields.description: Specifies the description attachments of the ticket.

fields.name: site
fields.description: Specifies the site to which the ticket is associated.

fields.name: department
fields.description: Specifies the department to which the ticket is associated.

fields.name: requester
fields.description: Specifies the requester for whom the ticket is created.

fields.name: techGroup
fields.description: Specifies the technician group to which the ticket is assigned.

fields.name: technician
fields.description: Specifies the technician to whom the ticket is assigned.

fields.name: status
fields.description: Specifies the status of the ticket. The value should be from the Status (name field) type.

fields.name: source
fields.description: Specifies the creation source of the ticket. This input is mandatory.

fields.name: priority
fields.description: Specifies the priority of the ticket. The value should be from the Priority (name field) type.

fields.name: impact
fields.description: Specifies the impact of the ticket. The value should be from the Impact (name field) type.

fields.name: urgency
fields.description: Specifies the urgency of the ticket. The value should be from the Urgency (name field) type.

fields.name: category
fields.description: Specifies the category of the ticket. The value should be from the Category (name field) type.

fields.name: subcategory
fields.description: Specifies the subcategory of the ticket. The value should be from the SubCategory (name field) type.

fields.name: cause
fields.description: Specifies the cause of the ticket. The value should be from the Cause (name field) type.

fields.name: subcause
fields.description: Specifies the sub-cause of the ticket. The value should be from the SubCause (name field) type.

fields.name: sla
fields.description: Specifies the SLA of the ticket.

fields.name: resolutionCode
fields.description: Specifies the resolution code of the ticket.

fields.name: customFields
fields.description: Specifies the custom fields values for the ticket. Each entry in the JSON would be a key-value. The key will be a system-generated, unique name of the custom field (columnName field of CustomField type). The value for text, paragraph, radio, select, numeric, decimal, date, datetime should be given as a string. The value for checkbox, multi-select should be an array of string.

fields.name: For example, the value could be {"udf1text": "value", "udf2mselect": ["value1", "value2"]}
addAdditionalRequester
fields.description: Specifies the additional requesters to be added.

fields.name: addFollowers
fields.description: Specifies the followers to be added.

fields.name: createdTime
fields.description: Specifies the datetime when the ticket was created.

fields.name: updatedTime
fields.description: Specifies the datetime when the ticket was updated.

fields.name: subSource
fields.description: Specifies the source with which integration the ticket was created from.

fields.name: sourceReferenceId
fields.description: Specifies the referenceId of the ticket in the integration the ticket was created from.

fields.name: addAssets
fields.description: Specifies the assets to be added

fields.name: suppressCloseNotification
fields.description: Indicates whether the close notification has to be suppressed while closing the ticket

fields.name: firstResponseTime
fields.description: The first response time of the ticket.

fields.name: resolutionTime
fields.description: The resolution time of the ticket.

fields.name: requestType
fields.description: Specifies the type of the ticket. This input is mandatory.

types.example:
{
  "subject": "Help! Internet is not working!",
  "description": "I cannot access my internet! I'm not sure what's happening!",
  "descriptionAttachments": [CreateAttachmentInput],
  "site": SiteIdentifierInput,
  "department": DepartmentIdentifierInput,
  "requester": UserIdentifierInput,
  "techGroup": TechnicianGroupIdentifierInput,
  "technician": UserIdentifierInput,
  "status": "New",
  "source": "FORM",
  "priority": "Critical",
  "impact": "High",
  "urgency": "High",
  "category": "Network",
  "subcategory": "Wireless",
  "cause": "Component issue",
  "subcause": "Hardware Issue",
  "sla": SLAIdentifierInput,
  "resolutionCode": "Permanent Fix",
  "customFields": {
    "udf1text": "value",
    "udf2date": "2022-05-06",
    "udf3dt": "2022-05-06T10:10:10",
    "udf5mselect": ["value1", "value1"]
  },
  "addAdditionalRequester": [UserIdentifierInput],
  "addFollowers": [UserIdentifierInput],
  "createdTime": "2022-05-05T10:30:00",
  "updatedTime": "2022-05-06T10:05:00",
  "subSource": "abc123",
  "sourceReferenceId": "xyz789",
  "addAssets": [AssetIdentifierInput],
  "suppressCloseNotification": true,
  "firstResponseTime": "2022-05-06T10:05:00",
  "resolutionTime": "2022-05-06T10:05:00",
  "requestType": "Incident"
}

types.name: CreateTicketNoteInput

fields.name: addedOn

}

types.name: CreateUserAssociationInput

fields.description: Specifies the site that will be associated to the user.

types.description: Specifies the input required to create user.

fields.name: firstName
fields.description: Specifies the first name of the user. This input is mandatory.

fields.name: lastName
fields.description: Specifies the last name of the user.

fields.name: email
fields.description: Specifies the email address of the user which is unique across the technicians and users. The email will be used for login. This input should be mandatory and unique.

fields.name: contactNumber
fields.description: Specifies the contact number of the user. It is recommended to provide the value in the standard format [+][country code][area code][local phone number].

fields.name: reportingManager
fields.description: Specifies the reporting manager identifier input for the user.

fields.name: roles
fields.description: Specifies the application role identifier input for the user. This input is mandatory.

fields.name: department
fields.description: Specifies the department of the user.

fields.name: addAssociations
fields.description: Specifies the associated sites.

fields.name: addGroups
fields.description: Specifies the list of technician groups that the user will be associated with if he has TECHNICIAN type role.

fields.name: customFields
fields.description: Specifies the custom fields values for the user. Each entry in the JSON would be key-value. The key will be a system-generated, unique name of the custom field (columnName field of CustomField type). The value for text, paragraph, radio, select, numeric, decimal, date, datetime should be given as a string. The value for checkbox, multi-select should be an array of string.

fields.name: For example, the value could be {"udf1text": "value", "udf2mselect": ["value1", "value2"]}

types.description: Specifies the identifier input for the module field.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The ID of the Field.

fields.name: columnName
fields.description: The name of the column of the field

fields.name: module
fields.description: The module of the field i.e. TICKET, COMPANY_USER

types.name: FieldType
types.description: The type of the field.

fields.name: TEXT
fields.description: The text field. The maximum length of the text value is 255 characters.

fields.name: PARAGRAPH
fields.description: The paragraph/multi-line field. The maximum length of the paragraph value is 65,535 characters. The maximum number of paragraph fields is 5.

fields.name: NUMERIC
fields.description: The whole number field. The maximum number of digits is 10.

fields.name: DECIMAL
fields.description: The decimal number field. The maximum number of digits is 10 and maximum number of digits in the fractional part is 2.

fields.name: DATE
fields.description: The date field. The date value should be specified in the ISO 8601 format i.e., 2022-08-15

fields.name: DATETIME
fields.description: The datetime filed. The datetime value should be specified in the ISO 8601 format i.e., 2022-08-15T13:15:30

fields.name: RADIO
fields.description: The radio field. The maximum length of an option value is 255 characters.

fields.name: CHECKBOX
fields.description: The checkbox field. The maximum length of an option value is 255 characters. The maximum number of checkbox fields is 64.

fields.name: SELECT
fields.description: The select/dropdown field. The maximum length of an option value is 255 characters.

fields.name: MULTI_SELECT
fields.description: The multi select field. The maximum length of an option value is 255 characters. The maximum number of checkbox fields is 64.

fields.name: RICH_TEXT
fields.description: The rich text field. used to store large formatted Text

fields.name: PASSWORD
fields.description: The password field. used to store password value.

fields.name: SECURE_TEXT
fields.description: The Secure text field. used to store secure text

fields.name: URL
fields.description: The URL field. used to store an url in secured text field type

types.name: KbArticle
types.description: Represents an article in the knowledge base. The article content can be downloaded using the download API with the below query parameters:

fields.name: itemId
fields.description: Unique identifier.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Title of the article.

fields.name: parent
fields.description: Parent KB Collection.

fields.name: description
fields.description: Summary of the article.

fields.name: status
fields.description: Status of the article.

fields.name: createdBy
fields.description: Details of the creator.

fields.name: createdOn
fields.description: Timestamp of when the article is created.

fields.name: lastModifiedBy
fields.description: Details of the last editor.

fields.name: lastModifiedOn
fields.description: Timestamp of when the article is last modified.

fields.name: viewCount
fields.description: Number of times the article has been viewed by the requesters.

fields.name: articleType
fields.description: Format of the content.

fields.name: visibility
fields.description: Sharing configurations.

fields.name: loginRequired
fields.description: Whether user login is required to access the article.

types.example:
{
  "itemId": "3047341892401414939",
  "name": "How to Set Up a Printer on Your Device",
  "parent": KbCollection,
  "description": "A step-by-step guide to help you connect and configure a printer on your computer or mobile device.",
  "status": "PUBLISHED",
  "createdBy": {
    "userId": "9001114136934215681",
    "name": "John Williams",
    "email": "john@log.com"
  },
  "createdOn": "2025-07-01T12:12:16.892",
  "lastModifiedBy": {
    "userId": "9001114136934215681",
    "name": "John Williams",
    "email": "john@log.com"
  },
  "lastModifiedOn": "2025-07-01T12:12:16.892",
  "viewCount": 1,
  "articleType": "HTML",
  "visibility": [DocumentSharedDetails],
  "loginRequired": true
}

fields.name: name
fields.description: Name of item, must be unique in the service catalog

fields.name: description
fields.description: A Short description about the Product

fields.name: category
fields.description: Identifier of the category under which the item is created

fields.name: itemId
fields.description: The ID of the worklog item.

fields.name: serviceItem
fields.description: Specifies the service item.

fields.name: qty
fields.description: The number of offered units/hours. The unit is hrs for HOURS type item.

fields.name: billDateTime
fields.description: The date and time that the worklog was added.

fields.name: notes
fields.description: The notes added to the worklog.

types.name: UpdateSiteInput
types.description: Specifies the input required to create a site.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The ID of the site.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the site. This input is mandatory.

fields.name: working24x7
fields.description: Specifies whether the site has specific business hours or works 24x7. This input is mandatory.

fields.name: businessHour
fields.description: Specifies the business hours of the site if working 24x7 is false.

fields.name: holidayList
fields.description: Specifies the holiday list of the site.

fields.name: timezoneCode
fields.description: Specifies the timezone of the site. The value should be specified in the IANA time zone database, for example, America/New_York. This input is mandatory.

fields.name: address
fields.description: Specifies the address of the site.

fields.name: contactNumber
fields.description: The contact number of the site.

types.name: UpdateTicketInput
types.description: Specifies the input required to update an existing ticket.

fields.name: ticketId
fields.description: The ID of the ticket going to be updated.

fields.name: subject
fields.description: Specifies the subject of the ticket.

fields.name: site
fields.description: Specifies the site to which the ticket is associated. Cannot be set to null.

fields.name: department
fields.description: Specifies the department to which the ticket is associated.

fields.name: requester
fields.description: Specifies the requester for whom the ticket is created.

fields.name: techGroup
fields.description: Specifies the technician group to which the ticket is assigned.

fields.name: technician
fields.description: Specifies the technician to whom the ticket is assigned.

fields.name: status
fields.description: Specifies the status of the ticket. The value should be from the Status (name field) type. Cannot be set to null.

fields.name: priority
fields.description: Specifies the priority of the ticket. The value should be from the Priority (name field) type.

fields.name: impact
fields.description: Specifies the impact of the ticket. The value should be from the Impact (name field) type.

fields.name: urgency
fields.description: Specifies the urgency of the ticket. The value should be from the Urgency (name field) type.

fields.name: category
fields.description: Specifies the category of the ticket. The value should be from the Category (name field) type.

fields.name: subcategory
fields.description: Specifies the subcategory of the ticket. The value should be from the SubCategory (name field) type.

fields.name: cause
fields.description: Specifies the cause of the ticket. The value should be from the Cause (name field) type.

fields.name: subcause
fields.description: Specifies the sub cause of the ticket. The value should be from the SubCause (name field) type.

fields.name: resolutionCode
fields.description: Specifies the resolution code of the ticket.

fields.name: source
fields.description: Specifies the creation source of the ticket. Cannot be set to null.

fields.name: customFields
fields.description: Specifies the custom fields values for the ticket. Each entry in the JSON would be key-value. The key will be a system-generated, unique name of the custom field (columnName field of CustomField type). The value for text, paragraph, radio, select, numeric, decimal, date, datetime should be given as a string. The value for checkbox, multi-select should be an array of string.

fields.name: For example, the value could be {"udf1text": "value", "udf2mselect": ["value1", "value2"]}
addAdditionalRequester
fields.description: Specifies the additional requesters to be added.

fields.name: deleteAdditionalRequester
fields.description: Specifies the additional requesters to be deleted.

fields.name: addFollowers
fields.description: Specifies the followers to be added.

fields.name: deleteFollowers
fields.description: Specifies the followers to be deleted.

fields.name: suppressCloseNotification
fields.description: Indicates whether the close notification has to be suppressed while closing the ticket

fields.name: firstResponseTime
fields.description: The first response time of the ticket.

fields.name: resolutionTime
fields.description: The resolution time of the ticket.

fields.name: requestType
fields.description: Specifies the type of the ticket. Cannot be set to null.

types.example:
{
  "ticketId": 4,
  "subject": "Help! Internet is not working!",
  "site": SiteIdentifierInput,
  "department": DepartmentIdentifierInput,
  "requester": UserIdentifierInput,
  "techGroup": TechnicianGroupIdentifierInput,
  "technician": UserIdentifierInput,
  "status": "New",
  "priority": "Critical",
  "impact": "High",
  "urgency": "High",
  "category": "Network",
  "subcategory": "Wireless",
  "cause": "Component issue",
  "subcause": "Hardware Issue",
  "resolutionCode": "Permanent Fix",
  "source": "FORM",
  "customFields": {
    "udf1text": "value",
    "udf2date": "2022-05-06",
    "udf3dt": "2022-05-06T10:10:10",
    "udf5mselect": ["value1", "value1"]
  },
  "addAdditionalRequester": [UserIdentifierInput],
  "deleteAdditionalRequester": [UserIdentifierInput],
  "addFollowers": [UserIdentifierInput],
  "deleteFollowers": [UserIdentifierInput],
  "suppressCloseNotification": true,
  "firstResponseTime": "abc123",
  "resolutionTime": "xyz789",
  "requestType": "abc123"
}

types.name: UpdateUserAssociationInput
types.description: Specifies the input required to update the user association.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Specifies the ID of the association.

fields.name: site
fields.description: Specifies the site which will be updated.

types.name: UpdateUserInput
types.description: Specifies the input required to update the information of an existing user.

fields.name: userId
fields.description: Specifies ID of the user whose recored is to be updated.

fields.name: firstName
fields.description: Specifies the first name of the user. Cannot be set to null.

fields.name: lastName
fields.description: Specifies the last name of the user.

fields.name: email
fields.description: Specifies the email address of the user. Cannot be set to null.

fields.name: contactNumber
fields.description: Specifies the contact number of the user. It is recommended to provide the value in the standard format [+][country code][area code][local phone number].

fields.name: reportingManager
fields.description: Specifies the reporting manager identifier input for the user.

fields.name: roles
fields.description: Specifies the application role identifier input for the user. Cannot be set to null.

fields.name: customFields
fields.description: Specifies the custom fields values for the user. Each entry in the JSON would be key-value. The key will be a system-generated, unique name of the custom field (columnName field of CustomField type). The value for text, paragraph, radio, select, numeric, decimal, date, datetime should be given as a string. The value for checkbox, multi-select should be an array of string.

fields.name: For example, the value could be {"udf1text": "value", "udf2mselect": ["value1", "value2"]}
addGroups
fields.description: Specifies the list of technician groups that the technician will be associated with.

fields.name: deleteGroups
fields.description: Specified the list of technician groups from which the technician will be disassociated.

fields.name: department
fields.description: Specifies the department that the user belongs to.

fields.name: updateAssociations
fields.description: Specifies the input required to update a user association i.e site.

types.name: UpdatedAsset

fields.description: ID of the asset

fields.name: name
fields.description: Name of the asset

fields.name: assetClass
fields.description: Asset class details of the asset

fields.name: site
fields.description: Site details of the asset

fields.name: department
fields.description: Department details of the asset

fields.name: requester

fields.name: customFields

types.name: User
types.description: The user in organization

fields.name: userId
fields.description: The ID of the user.

fields.name: firstName
fields.description: The first name of the user.

fields.name: lastName
fields.description: The last name of the user.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The full name of the user.

fields.name: email
fields.description: The email address of the user.

fields.name: contactNumber
fields.description: The contact number of the user. It is recommended to provide the value in the standard format [+][country code][area code][local phone number].

fields.name: reportingManager
fields.description: The reporting manager of the user. The actual type of this field is User. This field returns userId and name fields as JSON. The name and email fields can be used in the filter condition.

fields.name: roles
fields.description: The list of roles of the user. The actual type of this field is Roles. This field returns roleId and name fields as JSON.

fields.name: department
fields.description: The department of the user. The actual type of this field is Department. This field returns department and name fields as JSON. The name field can be used in the filter condition.

fields.name: associations
fields.description: The list of association of site present for the user. The actual type of this field is UserAssociation. This field returns associationId and site fields as JSON. The siteId can be used in the filter condition.

fields.name: Specifies the custom fields values for the user. Each entry in the JSON would be key-value. The key will be a system-generated, unique name of the custom field (columnName field of CustomField type). The value for text, paragraph, radio, select, numeric, decimal, date, datetime should be given as a string. The value for checkbox, multi-select should be an array of string.
For example, the value could be {"udf1text": "value", "udf2mselect": ["value1", "value2"]}

fields.name: listInfo
